Jack Ma and Ant Group, his Alibaba-offshoot payment processing firm have run afoul of the CCP's one rule: don't threaten the Chinese Communist Party's monopoly on political power.  Past disappearances from public life by prominent figures usually end up the same way: a reappearance in public after many weeks or months with abject confessions and apologies by the prominent person, followed by enormous fines or a jail sentence or both.  Jack Ma's attempts to move into financial services with his already gigantic market dominance with Alipay and his outspoken criticism of the CCP have likely cost him the ability to make Ant Group anything other than a payment processing firm due to the antitrust investigation launched as Ma disappeared from public.[1]  His criticism of the CCP's monopoly on political power will likely be even more catastrophic for Ma personally in terms of his wallet and personal freedom. On top of this, as others mention, COVID makes an international conferences that would serve as his venue to reappear much less likely. It is likely that the CCP will not allow Jack Ma to travel for a period of time and he will not take extreme efforts to leave the country. The CCP takes criticism from public figures very seriously. The recent case of Ren Zhiqiang serves as a good example. 
Zhiqiang was placed on a year's probation and not allowed to leave the country in 2016 after publicly criticizing Xi's propaganda policies. Notably, Zhiqiang was a CCP member (Ma is not). He publicly called out Xi in 2020 (not directly but very strongly implied) for mishandling of Covid-19 and restricting free speech. He disappeared shortly after. (https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/14/world/asia/china-ren-zhiqiang.html) This September 2020 article reveals he was later given 18 years in jail on counts of bribery, corruption, etc. which are likely fabricated. (https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-54245327) Side note: As a business man and not a politician (and not seeming to be driven by political ideals), his criticism of the party was primarily focused on how it was affecting his business Ali Baba. If the government has leaned in and put pressure on him (as it has a pattern of doing), he will likely be highly motivated to toe the line in the near term (i.e. not try to be smuggled out, as severing ties with the government will undermine his business due to Chinese business laws). His ability to moderately reassure investors through virtual appearances will also undermine his motivation to make more public appearances overseas.

It seems unlikely that Mr. Ma will appear in public outside of the PRC by 1 April due to other cases that are similar in nature to this one. Specifically, Fan BingBing was a public figure that broke Chinese law and dissapeared from public view for 3 months in 2018, and did not make a public appearance until April, 2019 [1]. Mr. Ma's trajectory seems to be following a similar flight path as he dissapeared from the public eye in October of 2020, and just released a video earlier this month [2]. Both Ms. Bingbing and Mr. Ma flaunted the Chinese communist party and, essentially embarrassed party leadership by coming across as being more powerful than the institution [3]. The Chinese communist party seems to have protocols in place that include public disappearance, followed by a video appearance, and finally public appearances and the the time span seems to encompass multiple months. Since Mr. Ma only just released a public video, it seems unlikely that he will make any public appearance any time soon, let alone outside of the PRC. This does not take into account the additional travel restrictions imposed by COVID-19 but that will, likely, also contribute to a lack of travel for Mr. Ma. Thus, I predict a 0% probability that Mr. Ma will make a physical appearance outside of the PRC before 1 April 2021. [1] https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/25/asia/fan-bingbing-back-china/index.html
[2] https://www.theguardian.com/business/2021/jan/20/chinese-billionaire-jack-ma-makes-first-public-appearance-in-months
[3] https://www.theguardian.com/business/2021/jan/23/the-strange-case-of-alibabas-jack-ma-and-his-three-month-vanishing-act

There is a low possibility that Jack Ma physically appears in public outside of the PRC for a few reasons: 1) CoVID continues to rage across the globe causing significant travel restrictions.  The two new variants of CoVID from the U.K. and South Africa will continue to put pressure on international travel.   2) Jack Ma criticized the CCP and the CCP is a well-known history of making prominent Chinese "disappear" for a few months.  Chinese actress Fan BingBing recently returned to the international scene after running afoul of CCP rules.  Jack Ma "lying low" is a euphemism for being punished by the CCP for his criticism.  It is highly doubtful the CCP will allow him to travel internationally at this time.   I would increase the probability that Jack Ma physically appears in public only if there is continued downward pressure on Alibaba's stock.  Although Jack Ma is no longer the CEO of Alibaba, he does own a tremendous number of shares.  His disappearance caused a precipitous drop in Alibaba's value; likewise, his return caused Alibaba to skyrocket in value once more.  Alibaba is a strategic asset for the CCP that allows them to compete with the likes of Amazon and they will not allow it to crater.
